author: APeard
title: PREVIEW: Oil Kings @ Kelowna Rockets 01.05.24 - Edmonton Oil Kings
text: PREVIEW: Oil Kings @ Kelowna Rockets 01.05.24 EDMONTON OIL KINGS (13-20-1-1) @ KELOWNA ROCKETS (17-16-2-0) – JANUARY 5, 2024 – PROSPERA PLACE – 8:00 PM [Game Notes](https://media.chl.ca/wp-content/uploads/sites/42/2024/01/05112508/20240105_EDM%40KEL_GameNotes.pdf) – [Follow along on X](https://twitter.com/EdmOilKings) – [Live Box Score ](https://chl.ca/whl/scores/)– [Listen on iHeartRadio Canada](https://www.iheart.com/live/edmonton-oil-kings-radio-9994/?cmp=ios_share&sc=ios_social_share&pr=false) 2023-24 Schedule vs. Kelowna Rockets Friday, Jan 5 @ Kelowna 2022-23 vs. Kelowna: 0-1-0-0 Home: 0-1-0-0 Away: 0-0-0-0 PP: 0/5 (0.0%) PK: 2/5 (60.0%) All-Time vs. Kelowna: 8-15-0-4 Home: 4-8-0-1 Away: 4-8-0-3 PP: 18/126 (14.3%) PK: 24/129 (81.4%) Matchup Notes Tonight marks the first and only meeting of the season between the Oil Kings and Rockets. Last season, the Rockets blanked the Oil Kings at Rogers Place on February 24, 2023 by a 4-0 score. The Rockets goals were supplied by Dylan Wightman(2), former Oil King Carson Golder and Trae Johnson. Talyn Boyko stopped all 27 shots he faced in the Rockets cage while Logan Cunningham turned away 36 of the 40 shots sent his direction. The Oil Kings last visit to Prospera Place was 1,501 days ago on November 26, 2019 a game in which they secured a 1-0 win via the shootout. Sebastian Cossa, 21 saves, and Roman Basran, 27 saves, were the two goalies of record to pick up the rare double shutout. Dylan Guenther scored the lone goal in the shootout. The Oil Kings and Rockets have met 27 times total in the regular season with eight of those games being decided in the shootout with both teams having four wins apiece in the skills competition. Coming In The Oil Kings come in riding a six-game point streak (5-0-1-0) and have back-to-back wins following a 3-1 win Wednesday night in Kamloops. Landon Hanson opened the scoring for Edmonton with a beautiful coast-to-coast rush late in the first period while Gracyn Sawchyn, who now has at least a point in all four games as an Oil King, scored a pair of goals setup by Ty Nash. Kolby Hay, playing in his 100th career WHL game and first in his virtual hometown of Kamloops, came within 90 seconds of picking up a shutout but still finished the night as the game’s first start after stopping 36 of 37 shots for his fifth consecutive victory in the Edmonton crease. The Rockets come in having won two straight games and four of their last five after a wild 7-6 win over the Calgary Hitmen on Saturday. Since November 21, 2023 the Rockets hold a record of 10-4-0-0. Their last five games have all been decided by two goals or less. EOK Notables Oil Kings defenceman Marc Lajoie sits 12th in defenceman points (28), 2nd in defenceman goals (12) and 1st in defenceman PP goals (8) in the WHL. With his eight power play goals, Lajoie ranks 2nd all-time amongst Oil Kings defencemen for PP goals in a single season, tied with Conner McDonald (8, 2018-19) and trails only Simon Kubicek (9, 2021-22). Adam Jecho ranks 10th in WHL rookie scoring with 20 points (9G, 11A) in just 22 games. Skyler Bruce has the 3rd best shooting % in the WHL having collected 11 goals on just 42 shots (26.2%). The Oil Kings have killed off 44 of the last 52 penalties they’ve taken over the past 16 games (84.6%). The Oil Kings PP has gone 22 for its last 88 over the past 21 games (25.0%) and has 24 goals in its last 23 games. The Oil Kings lead the WHL in attendance (5,642 avg.). KEL Notables Andrew Cristall sits 4th in WHL scoring with 60 points (21G, 39A) in 29 games. His 39 assists ranks 5th amongst all WHL skaters. He has recorded at least a point in 27 of the 29 games he has played this season and is currently riding a 16-game point streak (11G, 21A), the longest active point streak in the league. Tij Iginla sits 17th in WHL scoring with 47 points (26G, 21A) in 35 games. His 26 goals ranks 5th amongst all WHL skaters. He is currently riding a 9-game point streak (7G, 10A). Gabriel Szturc sits 20th in WHL scoring with 45 points (18G, 27A) in 29 games and is riding a 4-game goal streak (5G). Hiroki Gojsic sits 14th in WHL rookie scoring with 19 points (8G, 11A) in 35 games. Milestone Watch - F Marshall Finnie is 1 game away from 100 career WHL games. - F Gavin Hodnett is 7 games away from 100 career WHL games. Lineup Report - D Ethan MacKenzie, upper-body, month-to-month (Games missed: 16). - D Reid Larson, lower-body, month-to-month (Games missed: 11). - F Carter Kowalyk, upper-body, day-to-day (Games missed: 3). Streaks - F Ty Nash is on a 5-game point streak (6g-4a-10pts). - G Kolby Hay is on a 5-game winning streak. - F Gracyn Sawchyn is on a 4-game point streak (3g-2a-5pts). - F Gavin Hodnett is on a 2-game assist/point streak (1g-2a-3pts). - F Joe Iginla is on a 2-game point streak (1g-1a-2pts). Who’s Hot - F Gavin Hodnett has 30 points (6G, 24A) in his last 24 games. - D Marc Lajoie has 21 points (9G, 12A) in his last 23 games. - F Skyler Bruce has 22 points (11G, 11A) in his last 20 games. - F Roan Woodward has 13 points (5G, 8A) in his last 17 games. - F Ty Nash has 19 points (10G, 9A) in his last 13 games. - F Marshall Finnie has 12 points (6G, 6A) in his last 13 games. - F Adam Jecho has 10 points (4G, 6A) in his last 12 games. - F Gracyn Sawchyn has 10 points (4G, 6A) in his last 9 games. - D Matthew Gallant has 6 points (0G, 6A) in his last 7 games.

author: Anonym
title: In Russia, two poets heavily sentenced for a text hostile to the offensive in Ukraine - Teller Report
text: In Russia, two poets heavily sentenced for a text hostile to the offensive in Ukraine Up to seven years in prison for words. On Thursday, December 28, a Moscow court sentenced two men to long sentences for reciting verses against the Ukrainian offensive during a protest last year. Russian poets Artyom Kamardin (L) and Yegor Shtovba (R) stand inside the glass cage of the defendants during the announcement of the verdict at the Moscow court on December 28, 2023. AFP - ALEXANDER NEMENOV By: RFI Follow Advertising Read More The repression of dissenting voices in Russia continues unabated at the end of the year. According to the Russian NGO OVD-Info, nearly 20,000 Russians have been arrested since the beginning of the conflict in Ukraine for protesting against the Kremlin's policies. The NGO Memorial lists 633 political prisoners behind bars. The latest victims are two Russian poets who took part in a reading against the war in Ukraine, sentenced by a Moscow court to five-and-a-half and seven years in prison. Both men were convicted of inciting hatred against members of armed groups in Donbass and "publicly calling to commit activities against state security". Their fault? Participating in a public poetry reading in Moscow, near the statue of the poet Mayakovsky, a traditional gathering place for opponents of the government and dissidents since Soviet times. One of them claims to have been raped during his arrest At the event, 33-year-old Artyom Kamardin, who received the heaviest sentence, recited a poem hostile to pro-Russian separatists in eastern Ukraine. Like Yegor Shtovba, 23, who was sentenced to 5 2022/ years, he was arrested in September , the day after the public reading. During the search of his home, he claimed to have been beaten and raped with a dumbbell by police officers. His wife was also allegedly ill-treated by the police. Alexandra Popova, who was present in court for the sentencing, told AFP she regretted a "very severe" sentence, "for poetry, a non-violent offence". "If we had normal courts, this situation would not exist," she told reporters, before being taken away by police. Today, opposition leader Ksenia Fadeeva, a close associate of Alexei Navalny, must also be determined her fate. The 2020-year-old, who was elected in September 10 to the city council of Tomsk in Siberia and who was the head of the local office of Alexei Navalny's Anti-Corruption Fund, was on trial for extremism. On Thursday, the prosecutor asked for and a half years in prison. NewsletterGet all the latest international news straight to your inbox Subscribe now Follow all the international news by downloading the RFI app Share: Read on the same topics: - Russia - Culture - Ukraine

author: @twitter.com/jeremydgoodwin
title: St. Louis doctor sentenced to 35 months in federal prison for Medicaid and Medicare fraud
text:
News Briefs St. Louis doctor sentenced to 35 months in federal prison for Medicaid and Medicare fraud St. Louis Public Radio | By Jeremy D. Goodwin Published February 20, 2025 at 4:15 PM CST Facebook Twitter LinkedIn Email
Evie Hemphill / St. Louis Public Radio Dr. Sonny Saggar, photographed at St. Louis Public Radio for a 2018 interview, received a 35-month sentence in federal prison and was ordered to repay nearly $750,000 in fraudulent charges to Medicare and Missouri Medicaid. St. Louis physician Sonny Saggar is facing 35 months in federal prison and an order to repay $742,528 for defrauding Medicare and Missouri Medicaid, charges he admitted to in court last year.
U.S. District Judge Stephen R. Clark sentenced Saggar on Wednesday.
Saggar, 57, testified in August that he let assistant physicians treat patients and then billed Medicaid as if he had seen the patients personally – even when he was out of town during the office visits.
Missouri law requires doctors to supervise assistant physicians closely.
“Doctors are expected to follow a certain code of conduct and obey the laws and regulations put in place to protect their clients,” Michael Davis, DEA St. Louis Division special agent in charge, said in a statement.
“Our investigation shows that Dr. Saggar broke with protocol and endangered lives with his negligence. As a result of his misconduct, he was arrested, surrendered his DEA Certificate of Registration, can no longer prescribe controlled substances, and faces nearly three years in federal prison,” Davis added.
Saggar testified that he hired assistant physicians at St. Louis General Hospital locations in St. Louis and Creve Coeur between 2018 and 2023 but did not properly train them or oversee their decisions about patient care. He also recruited other physicians to falsely claim they were overseeing the assistants, according to the judge.
Saggar, a native of England, took public stands in favor of gun control and held various leadership positions with St. Louis health care facilities in addition to running the St. Louis General Hospital locations, as owner of North City Urgent Care and CEO of the distressed St. Alexius Hospital in south St. Louis.
Office manager Renita Barringer pleaded guilty to one count of conspiracy and faces sentencing next month.
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->financial and economic news

author: Alexander Joe
title: How does the How2Invest platform facilitate smart investing?
text:
How2Invest is an online platform striving to make investing more convenient, educational and affordable for everyone. Examining the solution in detail reveals a robust set of features catering to first-time investors as well as savvy experts seeking to maximize returns.
A Straightforward Interface Enabling Easy Investing
The How2Invest trading platform stands out through its intuitive interface, enabling seamless navigation. Unlike convoluted traditional investing sites, clean design principles guide users efficiently through asset research and trading workflows. Simplicity in site architecture proves essential to encouraging more widespread retail investment by eliminating unnecessary obstacles.
Extensive Learning Resources Empowering Informed Financial Decisions
Supplementing the well-designed trading portal,
How2Invest delivers a deep repository of educational materials to build investors’ financial literacy. Through articles, video tutorials and written guides, the site helps users comprehend essential concepts around investments spanning stocks and ETFs to real estate and cryptocurrency. Compiling these resources represents a commitment to advancing financial equality by arming more individuals with actionable knowledge for long-term prosperity.
Cost Advantages to Democratize Investing Opportunities
In a move highlighting the solution’s commitment to accessibility, How2Invest levies reasonable annual fees amounting to just 0.25% of assets to cover expenses, substantially below averages across the wealth management industry. Reducing typically excessive investment charges opens participation in capital markets to everyday people, not just high-net-worth individuals. This philosophy will progressively democratize retail investing.
Evaluating Core Investment Options Through a Beginner’s Lens
Examining How2Invest’s core financial instruments using simplified terminology assists novice investors in assessing options catering to different objectives. Stocks confer part ownership in companies; bonds are fixed-rate loans paid back over time; and diverse funds aggregate expertly curated collections of securities for simplified diversification. Determining one’s individual goals and risk appetite before selecting among these building blocks proves essential.
Practical Steps to Start Investing Through How2Invest
While deciding how to allocate hard-earned savings across markets initially appears daunting, How2Invest helps overcome inertia through clear guidance on getting started. First, sign up for a suitable low-cost investment account like a Roth IRA. Next, direct funds not needed for daily expenses into this vehicle while educating yourself using the provided resources. Finally, deploy your developing knowledge to invest incrementally in thoroughly researched assets matching your strategy.
Future Outlook for Accessible, Low-Cost Investing Solutions
How2Invest represents the vanguard of a movement towards simplified, reasonably-priced retail investing by minimizing complexity and barriers preventing mainstream wealth creation. As technology continues to advance security and efficiency alongside greater education, expect more participation in this financial revolution until
sound investing principles become commonplace household knowledge. For now, How2Invest delivers the tools to start benefiting from smarter money management immediately.
Conclusion
Ultimately, How2Invest is an innovative platform that is transforming the investment landscape. With its budget-friendly fees and user-friendly interface, it is an excellent choice for both conservative investors and seasoned ones.
Effective financial planning is essential for successful investing, and How2Invest enables users to make strategic decisions about allocating their funds according to their long-term goals. By prioritizing their investments, individuals can optimize their financial growth over time.
One of the remarkable features of How2Invest is its distinctive approach to investing. The platform provides users with a broad range of investment opportunities, such as stocks, ETFs, and mutual funds, offering a diverse selection to consider. This variety is essential for minimizing risk and maximizing profits.
Overall, How2Invest is an excellent choice for people looking to make intelligent investments with their finances. Thanks to its competitive pricing, user-friendly interface, and extensive selection of investment options, it has become a favored choice among investors, regardless of their level of expertise. Furthermore, for those who are curious about
PDFDrive, staying informed about the latest news can be done by following updates on Google.

author: Monique Tamminga
title: It’s golfing weather in December for the South Okanagan - Kelowna Capital News
text: If you’ve felt like this has been a historically mild December, you’d be right. Osoyoos set a new temperature record for Dec. 28, with a balmy 6.9 C. According to Environment Canada’s weather summaries, the old record for this day was 6.2 C, set in 1994. Records in this area have been kept since 1954. In Penticton, on Dec. 28, it’s sitting at 7 C. Every day of December hovered around 5 C. Last year, Okanagan Lake was frozen over at the shoreline. This year, it looks like spring. Even Kevin, the famous broken-winged goose is finding it balmy. Old School Penticton posted a picture of Kevin hanging out with some feathered friends and he captioned the photo, “The King & Queen have their very own island. It ain’t Hawaii, but we’ve all been invited to the Lūʻau. It’s B.Y.O.P. (Bring Your Own Pineapple).” Penticton Golf and Country Club is still open, with many members able to hit the greens every day of this month. According to the weather forecasts, the South Okanagan will finish out 2023 a little colder but it won’t dip below 0 C during the day. Jan. 1, New Year’s Day looks to be great weather to take the Polar Bear Dip. Daytime temperatures will be around 1 C. [READ MORE: Snow for Xmas Day? Don’t count on it](https://www.pentictonwesternnews.com/local-news/white-christmas-in-the-okanagan-dont-count-on-it-experts-say-7288777)

author: TOI Tech Desk
title: Samsung drops official teaser for Galaxy Unpacked event - Times of India
text: Samsung is gearing up to host its next Galaxy Unpacked event in Paris on July 10. Ahead of that, the company has dropped a new global teaser -- titled Unfold your story with Galaxy AI -- of the event to build anticipation around the upcoming announcements during the event. Watch -- Official Teaser: Unfold your story with Galaxy AIhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KygT3Vn4IikSmasung Galaxy Unpacked teaser decodedThe video highlights the key benefits of foldable smartphones and other devices that may be announced at the event. The video uses a series of action verbs to encourage viewers to be creative and not be afraid to try new things. Phrases like “explore a new genre,” “change your angle,” and “ride a different wave” all suggest that this product will help people experiment with their creative process. The line “break barriers” further emphasises that this tool is meant to help people overcome creative obstacles.The teaser ends with the phrase “unfold your story”.In the teaser, Samsung invites fans around the world to step beyond boundaries and enjoy new, unique experiences. Samsung Galaxy Unpacked: What to expectDuring the event, Samsung is expected to announce its next-generation foldable smartphones and wearable devices, including its first wearable ring. The Galaxy Z Fold6 and Galaxy Z Flip6 are speculated to come with an updated -- Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 chipset -- similar to the Galaxy S24 series. Additionally, leaks and rumours have confirmed the Galaxy Buds3 Pro and Galaxy Watch 7 series that will soon launch at the event.

author: EFE
title: Wembanyama dice adiós a la temporada en la NBA por un coágulo sanguíneo en el hombro
text:
Baloncesto
Wembanyama dice adiós a la temporada en la NBA por un coágulo sanguíneo en el hombro
Los San Antonio Spurs informaron de que la trombosis venosa fue detectada tras el regreso del jugador del All-Star del pasado fin de semana
EFE
El pívot y estrella francesa de los San Antonio Spurs Victor Wembanyama se perderá el resto de la temporada de la NBA por un coágulo sanguíneo en el hombro derecho, según informó este jueves la franquicia texana.
Los Spurs indicaron que la trombosis venosa fue detectada tras el regreso de Wembanyama del All-Star, que se disputó el pasado fin de semana en San Francisco (California).
De acuerdo con ESPN, los Spurs creen que se trata de un "problema aislado" para Wembanyama, que fue elegido como número 1 del 'draft' de 2023, 'rookie' del año de la NBA en 2024 y que había sido llamado por primera vez para el All-Star.
El pívot francés promediaba esta temporada 24,3 puntos, 11 rebotes, 3,7 asistencias y 3,8 tapones por partido.
Con estos números, Wembanyama era el favorito para hacerse con el premio de defensor del año al final de la temporada regular.
Los Spurs, con la baja de Wembanyama, prácticamente se despiden de sus opciones de 'play-off', pues actualmente suman 23 victorias y 29 derrotas y son duodécimos en el Oeste.
